Query: Read the contents of a zipped file without extraction?

Answers.MP Summary: list, test and extract compressed files in a ZIP archive
Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_329752: Parallel read the contents of a zipped file without extraction
so_45863093: read the files one by one in a zip file using bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_45863093: unzip -l sample.zip |sed '
  /^ *[0-9][0-9]* *2[0-9-]*  *[0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9]  */!d; s///
' |while IFS= read file
  unzip -p sample.zip "$file" |gunzip -c |while IFS= read line
    # do stuff to "$line" here
  done
done

unzip -p

unzip -l archive.zip

unzip -p sample.zip |gunzip -c |while read line
  # do stuff to "$line"
done

unzip -p archive

Explanations about Options.-p:
extract files to pipe (stdout). Nothing but the file data is sent to stdout , and
 the files are always extracted in binary format, just as they are stored (no
 conversions).
